meanings.definition: Take away (something) from a particular place or position.
meanings.sent1: The thief abduced the precious jewel from the museum.
meanings.sent2: The kidnapper abduced the child from the playground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel abduced all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm abduced the sand from the beach, reshaping the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The magician abduced the coin from behind the volunteer's ear.

meanings.definition: To draw or bring (something) closer to a particular point.
meanings.sent1: The magnet abduced the metal paperclips on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The tractor abduced the trailer closer to the barn.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner abduced all the dust bunnies under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The black hole abduced the surrounding stars into its gravitational pull.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice abduced the audience closer to the stage.
